data.title: Corrupt download of VSCode using wget continue option
data.body:
- VSCode Version: All (has been happening for months)
- OS Version: Windows

This isn't a VS Code issue, but something about the VSCode site configuration. Due to a combination of the way the dowload is configured and a crazy proxy corporation configuration, all my downloads of VSCode are interrupted at 20M. If I try to use a tool as wget to continue an interrupted download, the resulting file is an invalid one. 

## Steps to reproduce 

1. under cygwin run `wget -c --no-check-certificate https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=623231 `
2. the download will fail at more or less 20M
3. I run again the same command to continue the dowload
4. rename the file to vscode-win.zip
5. unzip the file
6. Try to run Code.exe. The program starts but is corrupted. The main screen is broken.

data.title: alert bar at top of screen overlaps the tabs
data.body:
it was OK, but these days the warnings are things you can't fix on Mac / Unity.

Plus it's highly annoying. The UX equivalent of nails on a chalkboard seeing that pop up with some useless info every time you switch a branch or start Unity etc. 

Can you guys entertain making a setting to A: turn it off or B: make it go away automatically or appear at the bottom of the screen or something?

data.title: Git Functionality Stopped Working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z)

I have lost any git functionality within the GUI.  This integration was one of my favorite features.  Please help!

Steps to Reproduce:

data.title: Test: Grunt auto detection for terminal task runner
data.body:
Complexity: 1

- [x] Any OS - @egamma  (best person to test is egamma. He implemented this for the old output runner)

To get the new terminal runner more on par with the old output runner Grunt autodetection got implemented. To test:

- new workspace
- install grunt
- create a grunt file
- add a tasks.json with this single content:
```json
{
    "version": "2.0.0"
}
```
- ensure that the tasks in the grunt file are auto detected even without listing them in the tasks.json
- ensure that you can turn grunt auto detection off using the setting `"grunt.autoDetect": "off"`

data.title: Support for Visual Basic REM Keyword.
Your Updates Suck
data.body:
The last two times I tried to update this software, I had to go in and find and manually shut down rogue VS processes running through my computer's Resource Monitor because the update failed. Luckily, I was able to pretty quickly figure that out both times, but many users might not. Its a quality IDE, but the updates are total garbage.  Just an FYI

<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to update
2. Update fails

data.title: Use variable count to automatically detect expensive scopes
data.body:
Currently debugging a program with a large number of local variables simply crashes the debugger. Does the new inspector protocl let us just query for the number of variables in a scope without getting all of them. If that is possible we could automatically mark some scopes as `expensive` so vscode would not automatically expend them.

Here is an example repository made by @weinand 

[many locals.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/955179/many.locals.zip)

data.title: Test IntelliSense sorting
data.body:
Test for: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23643
Complexity: 1

- [x] Any OS - @rebornix 

IntelliSense results are not sorted by how well they match the text left of the cursor. Test that
* suggestions are sorted nicely while typing
* suggestion are sorted lexicographical when there is no text left of the cursor
* snippet sorting rules (top, inline, bottom) still apply

data.title: Search viewlet doesn't get selected text from diff editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (e6d0de3cb1aea432d498561e103bb7ee806e9da7, 2017-04-25T06:56:33.218Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
---

EDIT: I just checked this out on `1.11.2` and it behaves like I would like -- so it seem that this is a regression in the insiders builds.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the File explorer viewlet
2. Select some text in an editor
3. Press `⇧⌘F` to open the search viewlet
4. 👍 Observe that the search input contains the selected text

1. Open the Search viewlet
2. Select some text in an editor
3. Press `⇧⌘F` to open the search viewlet
4. 🐛 Observe that the search input DOES NOT contains the selected text

The search viewlet should contain the selected text in both cases

data.title: [TypeScript] `this` context lost within lambda expression after step out from inner call
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Windows 8.1 x64
- OS Version: 1.11.2
- Debugger for Chrome version: 3.0.1
- Chrome version: 58.0.3029.81

`this` became `undefined` within lambda expression after step out from
```typescript
const cell = this.createCell(column);
```
The breakpoint was initially set deeply inside `this.createCell(column)` call.

![untitled3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4777512/25386155/0a456776-29cf-11e7-9c0d-07a27c6c3ef4.png)

data.title: Spectron Smoketest
data.body:
- [x] Fully automate parts of smoke test on Windows - npm install & run a script. Anybody in team can run it.
- [x] Explore visual review by talking screenshots 
- [x] Can run smoke test against insiders/stable
- [x] Support to run smoketest during integration builds/CI (moved to #27845)
- [x] Support incremental wait timeouts on test failures
- [x] Make tests more robust by adding 'test classes' to DOM elements, add data attributes _(investigated)_
- [x] Implement [the full smoke test](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test)
  - [x] Data Migration
  - [x] Data Loss
  - [x] First User Experience
  - [x] Explorer
  - [x] Configuration and views
  - [x] Search
  - [x] CSS
  - Markdown _(skipped, webview has nodeIntegration == false)_
  - [x] JavaScript
  - [x] Debugging JavaScript _(no debug run-time test)_
  - [x] Git
  - [x] Integrated Terminal
  - [x] Status bar
  - [x] Tasks
  - [x] Extensions
  - Accessibility _(skipped due to no voice-over coverage from Spectron)_
  - [x] Localization
- [x] Support to run smoke test against fresh user data and populated user data
- [x] Contributing.md that documents how to contribute a new smoke test
- [x] Run on multiple platforms
- [x] Support Insiders (e.g. window title checks)
- [x] _Explore smarter addressing of editor span tags_



### Issues
- [x] Passing the user data directory to the spectron tests (https://github.com/electron/spectron/issues/189)
- [x] WebDriverIO command deprecation warnings due to ChromeDriver not implementing W3C WebDriver spec _(solved by redirecting warnings to separate log)_

### Unresolvable Issues
- Faking native dialogs - context menu, dialog popups (e.g. in getting asked for save on dirty editor close)

data.title: Intellisense sometimes doesn't work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|flow-for-vscode|flowtype|0.5.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.5.1|
|Align|steve8708|0.2.0|;


---
Hi guys, first of all, vscode is a very powerful tool. I use it for my frontend development, Lately I have been facing issues with iIntellisense, i.e. sometimes it doesn't work. When I hover over a variable, it just show loading text. When I cmd + click on a particular function, it doesn't go to the it's definition.
Whenever I encounter it I have to restart the vscode to make it working.

I don't have steps to reproduce, but I suspect |vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8| is impacting the intellisense.

data.title: Falling into external javascript on debugging Angular 4 app with smartStep enabled
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

While debugging some Angular 4 CLI TypeScript-based project I often fall into `C:\project\~\rxjs\Subscriber.js` file after `Step over` or `Step out` despite of the `launch.json` containing:
```
sourceMap: true,
smartStep: true
```

Shouldn't it be skipped because of `smartStep` enabled?

data.title: Delete Breakpoint does not work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Display the debug-menu on the left side to see what I mean. 
2. Set a breakpoint. 
3. Press F5 (code hits BP) press F5 again to finish the run.
4. Delete BP (you will see the breakpoint disappear in the debug-menu) and press F5 again.
5. VSC will stop at the former breakpoint again.
6. Click debug in the upper menu and click "delete all breakpoints" -> will delete one or multiple BP for good.

data.title: Implement smooth scrolling feature
Add support for per-project theme
data.body:
Use case: I work on several project (main long term project and spinoffs/experiments) and it would help if I could set a project-specific theme in project settings. That way I could apply different theme for my main project to make it easily recognizable, and the other smaller projects could stay on default theme.

I realize that one of the problems is that this preference probably shouldn't be synced to other users with a same project, so it would need a storage that is neither user-global, nor project-specific. A per-user-and-project storage.

data.title: Strange behaviour when having fast key-repeat
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using the VIM (v 0.6.18) plugin (not sure if it has to do with this perhaps?)
2. Press "x" do remove a character. Pressing repeatedly works as expected, but holding down it starts to erase but suddenly starts erasing next line. See gif linked below.

https://giphy.com/gifs/3ohzdSoSaRtwqTh3nW

Expected behaviour would be to erase the current row and stop erasing when the row is depleted.
